title: Basil Buckwheat
instructions: Rinse the buckwheat groats under cold water and drain.

In a saucepan, bring 2 cups of water to a boil. Add the rinsed buckwheat groats and reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 10-12 minutes or until the buckwheat is tender and the water is absorbed.
In a separate skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add the minced garlic and saut√© for about 1-2 minutes until fragrant.
Add the diced tomatoes to the skillet and cook for another 3-4 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together.
Season the tomato sauce with salt and pepper to taste.
Once the buckwheat is cooked, add it to the skillet with the tomato sauce.
Stir in the chopped fresh basil leaves and mix well to combine.
Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes to heat through and let the flavors infuse.
